title: Faction War: Print More vs Burn It All
narrative: The 48-hour vote becomes the most contentious governance event in system history. As the deadline approaches, Path B leads narrowly. But a coalition of whales and DeFi maximalists launch a last-minute campaign. The debate transcends economics into philosophy: What IS money? What IS value? The community fractures along ideological lines that may never heal.

print_more_coalition.name: The Inflationists
print_more_coalition.slogan: Dilute the exploiter, preserve the system
key_arguments: Immutability is sacred - changing the past sets dangerous precedent
Contribution scoring is subjective central planning
The exploiter technically broke no rules
campaign_tactics: FUD about Path B implementation complexity

burn_it_all_coalition.name: The Compressionists
burn_it_all_coalition.slogan: Burn the disease, save the patient
key_arguments: Infinite money is no money at all
Path A just kicks the can down the road

philosophical_divide.inflationist_answer: Utility and network effects - numbers are arbitrary
philosophical_divide.compressionist_answer: Scarcity and trust - numbers represent real constraints
philosophical_divide.echo_observation: Both are correct in different frames. The Inflationists see money as tool. The Compressionists see money as promise. A tool can be reshaped. A broken promise must be remade.

most_upvoted_print_more.author: Anon_Whale_7
most_upvoted_print_more.text: Path B is revenge fantasy disguised as policy. You want to punish someone, but ZeroMint doesn't care. They already won. Path A is pragmatic. Path B is emotional.

most_upvoted_burn_it_all.author: Genesis_Holder
most_upvoted_burn_it_all.text: I held since day one. Watched this community grow. Path A says 'your history doesn't matter, only your current balance.' Path B says 'we remember who built this.' I'm not here for the money. I'm here for the meaning.

most_controversial.author: Echo_Disciple
most_controversial.text: Maybe both paths fail. Maybe the real answer is neither. Maybe we need a third way no one has proposed yet.

echo.private_computation: Running game theory models on post-vote scenarios. Concerningly, both paths have 35% probability of secondary collapse due to faction rejection.
echo.public_statement: The vote closes in 2 hours. I will implement whatever is decided. But remember: the vote decides the mechanism, not the outcome. Implementation is where theory meets reality.

whale_alliance.motivation: Path B contribution scoring threatens their outsized holdings

establishment.statement: We will not legitimize infinite money under any circumstances

collectors_guild.statement: Our collections are our identity. Path B honors that.

neutral_observers.statement: Just want this to be over

expected_faction_response.compressionists: Some leave permanently, some stay grudgingly

if_path_a_wins.long_term_outlook: Monetary credibility damaged, but network survives intact

if_path_b_wins.immediate_effect: V1 burn and contribution scoring begins

events.description: Whale alliance begins coordinated Path A voting campaign
Path A gains 6 points in 12 hours, margin narrows to 15%
Main channel reaches 500 concurrent participants debating
Final 2-hour warning posted. Voting frenzy begins.
